statement.tex: \\ \textbf{Right or wrong? }\text{For f(x) to be defined}\\ x \text{ must satisfy the following condition.}
\\ \text{If }9-x^2\geq 0, \text{ then would the following}\\ \text{values of x satisfy the condition?}

options.tex: \textbf{No condition }\text{on }x.\\ \text{It can be any real number.}

reason.tex: \text{We did say that }f(x)\text{ is a real-valued}\\ \text{function. Which means, }f(x)\in\mathbb{R}. \\ \text{And for }f(x)\in\mathbb{R}, 9-x^2\geq 0\\ \implies (3-x)\cdot(3+x)\geq 0.

\begin{tabular}{c|c|c|c} & 3-x & 3+x & 9-x^2 \\ \hline x\lt -3 & + & - & - \\ -3\leq x\leq 3 & + & + & + \\ x\gt 3 & - & + & - \\ \hline \end{tabular} \\ \text{This means that the valid values of x}\\ \text{are all in }[-3,3]\implies\textbf{ domain } = [-3,3].

options.tex: \begin{tabular}{c|c|c} & & \text{ At x} \\ \hline \text{Minimum} & 0 & x = \pm 3 \\ \text{Maximum} & 3 & x = 0 \end{tabular} \\ \text{Hence, the }\textbf{range }\text{ of f(x) } = [0,3].
\begin{tabular}{c|c|c} & & \text{ At x} \\ \hline \text{Minimum} & 0 & x = 3 \\ \text{Maximum} & 3\sqrt{2} & x = -3 \end{tabular} \\ \text{Hence, the }\textbf{range }\text{ of f(x) } = [0,3\sqrt{2}].

reason.tex: \text{The less you subtract from }9-x^2,\text{ the}\\ \text{greater }f(x) = \sqrt{9-x^2}\text{ will be.}\\ \text{Hence, }f(x)\text{ is greatest at }x = 0\text{ and }\\ \text{least at }x = \pm 3.
